intro: Calcareoboea coccinea, commonly known as the red-flowered rock orchid, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking red petals and is typically found in rocky or limestone-rich environments. The plant belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils. Its flowers are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Calcareoboea coccinea is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance in its native habitat.
